page.title: 01The Country West of Penzance
page.content: This area is covered mainly by small grassy fields of approximately 5 acres enclosed by Cornish hedges built of granite stone and earth. The hedges are covered by plants, brambles and bushes giving good coverage for animal life. The grass fields are used mainly for feeding Guernsey and fresian cattle.A few fields grow Cauliflower. The granite outcrops are rugged and support heathers, bracken and brambmles. The banks of the little river valleys are covered with bracken. This area has numerous standing stones and ancient barrows plus the prehistoric village of Carn Euny. The drift reservoir is fairly new and serves west Cornwall. Small country lanes disect the area but only 2/12 are seved by a bus route.
